meanings.definition: Showing or promising no abatement of severity, intensity, strength, or pace.
meanings.sent1: The relentless storm battered the coast without stopping.
meanings.sent2: Her relentless studying paid off when she aced the exam.
meanings.sent3: The relentless rain seemed determined to ruin the picnic.
meanings.sent4: His relentless determination to succeed was like a force of nature.
meanings.sent5: The relentless heat of the desert made every step feel like a struggle.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's relentless rules left no room for leniency.
meanings.sent2: The relentless judge handed out harsh sentences to all offenders.
meanings.sent3: The relentless traffic made the commute feel like a never-ending journey.
meanings.sent4: His relentless focus on perfection made him a formidable competitor.
meanings.sent5: The relentless cold of winter froze everything in its path.

meanings.sent1: The relentless ticking of the clock echoed through the empty room.
meanings.sent2: Her relentless dedication to her craft earned her respect from all.
meanings.sent3: The relentless barking of the dog annoyed the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The relentless flow of the river carved a deep canyon over time.
meanings.sent5: The relentless march of time stops for no one.
